website_summaries.verdict: This versatile multi-sport sandal from Chaco, the Mega Z/Cloud, generally impressed users. Its trendy look did not compromise performance, especially in terms of comfort, surface traction, and arch support. Despite these good points, a few mishaps were raised. Everything considered, the pros presented by the Chaco Mega Z/Cloud evidently outweighed its cons, making it worth a shot.
pros: A large number of users appreciated the Chaco Mega Z/Cloud because of its adequate arch support
It was commended by the majority for its right-out-of-the-box comfort
According to hordes of owners, the strap of the Mega Z/Cloud was easy to adjust
The stylish look of this multi-sport sandal was complimented by numerous consumers
An abundance of brand loyalists stated that this gear had softer straps than their other Chaco sandals
Wearers in droves highly recommended this product for its versatility
A professional footwear critic applauded the Mega Z/Cloud’s super sticky ChacoGrip outsole
cons: Less than a handful of owners criticized the sandal for taking too long to dry
Some users mentioned that there was too much strap dangling near the ankle area after adjustment

customer_reviews.title: Chacos are the best sandels.
customer_reviews.text: Chacos are the best because they are thick enough to protect your feet even when hiking fairly brought terrain, but don't have any uncomfortable velcro, or straps between your toes or any other unpleasant feelings many sandels have. They also work like small flippers when you swim. These are particularly nice in that the webbing is nice and wide, and Chacos always adjust nice and easy when you first get them. Once you wear them a while, you will have to spend some time trying to wash the sand out of tunnel where the strap passes through the sole. Not much choice but to pull the strap back and forth and hose off all of the sand each time.
customer_reviews.author: smarquis

customer_reviews.title: Good & Bad
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable & well made. My only complaint is that where the strap connects with the base of back of the sandal on the outer side causes blisters? I’ve tried having the straps tight, loose & in the middle, all to the same effect.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi S

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy but a bit heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these about a week and only worn them three of four times. They fit great and have an extend arch support which I really like. It is not a high arch just long. They are a bit heavier than I expected but I believe that is because of the sole being so dense. Because of this I expect them to be very durable and long lasting. I am really hard on shoes and flip flops but these seem like they will hold up even to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toughest Sandal Made
customer_reviews.text: These definitely weren’t my first pair of Chaco’s. But I will say they are way more comfortable then the older ones. I got almost 20 years of hard core use out of my first pair. They saw days and days of river and lake use.But I had to retire them. In 2006 I bought my second pair, they were horrible. I was never able to wear them for long periods of time. So..... of coarse went back to old faithful. Thank you Chaco for listening and creating a sandal that is even better than the original.
customer_reviews.author: D-Jack

customer_reviews.title: True to size & comfortable for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son, and he says they are great quality, very comfortable. His feet are quite a bit wider at the top and a narrow heal and he said they fit perfectly and don’t squeeze the tops of his feet. He’s wore them hiking and through creeks and says they are just what he needed for a good hike.
customer_reviews.author: XaRay

customer_reviews.title: Made for fat feet?
customer_reviews.text: The sole fits very well and the one-strap adjustment works fine, EXCEPT - it's too long and the strap would drag the floor/ground when wearing. I have a medium width foot, men's size 11.5, and the strap was just too long and I had to return them. If a had a fat foot I suppose it would take up another inch or so of the strap, but they made it just too long. I went with the Keen Jerry Garcia Uneek X, and while it's 50 bucks more, it fits great,
customer_reviews.author: Mark H

customer_reviews.title: My favorite sandal!
customer_reviews.text: These chacos are the only ones I can wear. They're so nice and squishy, the straps are wide and softer than the normal straps, and the buckle is metal for durability! They're wide enough for my feet and there are some cute color options, even for someone looking for something a little on the feminine/cutesy side. I can walk in these for hours. This is my second pair, and I got a great deal on these!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect sandal, per husband. He especially likes the heel support. However, I gave him a blind test between two nearly identical sandals from two manufacturers. One pair $86. The other pair $23. Guess which one was the best? You got it, the $86. It’s ok since he currently has the cheaper brand worn almost through. He has glued the layers of the sole back together twice.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Best
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think Chacos could get any better but the softer sole and wider straps really make a difference. I'm president of a local walking club and these are my walking shoes. After a long Minnesota winter, I usually have a bit of a break in period each spring. I don't expect that to be the case next year with the wider straps.
customer_reviews.author: Plainvolks

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The thumbnails in the listing did not align correctly. The print or pattern that I was sent is not the pattern I clicked on to purchase. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't worn Chacos... just buy some already. You're here reading reviews to see if they are worth the money. They are. I've had Tevas and a variety of others. They are okay, but Chacos are my go-to. These (Z-Cloud) have the wider bands over your foot. They are comfortable and have the cloud cushioning so they're super soft. The arch support is great. I would highly recommend these sandals.
customer_reviews.author: zac land

customer_reviews.title: Only for high arches.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product for high arches. For regular folks, IMHO, the hight of arch makes it difficult to use at all. I wish they made the version with more common support. Best adjustability ever.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: My feet, knees, hips and back thank you Chaco. It is hard to believe a sandal could be this comfortable, and reduce standing stress this much. I have a pair of Teva's which are great sandals, however, these blew them away. They are in a class by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Way better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Great sandal, expensive feeling, durable and great fit. The color and style were perfect. I had tried a Teva sandal first, but that felt cheap and hurt my foot. This, on the other hand, was well worth the money. And, it was the same price as the Teva! So if you're on the fence about which to buy, hands down - it's the Chaco.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best footwear on the planet
customer_reviews.text: As far as I'm concerned, these are nearly indestructible, and if I could only own a single pair of shoes, these would be it. Comfortable and practical. Healthy for your feet, and protective too.
customer_reviews.author: borogoves

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After looking at the instructions, I adjusted them, put them on, and found that the arch support was amazing. They look to be very sturdy, and have a quite supportive foot bed overall.
customer_reviews.author: Aardvark (fka Dalesky)

customer_reviews.title: It fits to true size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my husband. He needs good sandals with support for his ankle. He is satisfied with the look, color and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Norori

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable sturdy sandal.
customer_reviews.text: Great sandals. It took a week to break in but we'll worth it! I love the arch support as I cannot use flat footed shoes. I used these sandals every day on my vacation to Mexico and they performed as expected! Best sandals I ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals. Get them on sale!!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. Got them for $50 and very pleased. I’ve heard they won’t last as long as my Z1s but if they last at least a year, they will be worth it. I’ve had my Z1s for 8 years. Still wear them! Chacos are great!
customer_reviews.author: FAU

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable sandals I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had other pairs of sandals from the Chaco brand but these are my favorite by far. Great support, soft bands, and the name says it all because it does feel as though you're walking on a cloud. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: gftarcha

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Best sandles I've ever worn. They seem very durable, although I've only worn them a few days each week this past summer. I wear a size 13 and they fit great except maybe a little narrow for wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Maddog Phipps

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm size 8 and narrow feet. These chacos are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: David Quintana

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sandal
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are definitely worth the price. They’re beyond comfortable and easy to slip on. I haven’t tested them on a hiking trip, but I don’t have any negative things to say about them as a day to day sandal
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Michael Rinder

customer_reviews.title: noice
customer_reviews.text: Im a nike mens 7. Delicious to walk about in.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Powell

customer_reviews.title: Fly kicks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t taken them off. The world is into colorful shoes, why not make the sandals colorful as well!!??? I love mine!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L.

customer_reviews.title: Walk in water and keep them on.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of walking in creeks and small streams. Works great for this.
customer_reviews.author: Kb

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Chaco’s with these - I loved the old ones but these are even better. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals
customer_reviews.text: Sandals fit well and were comfortable wearing them all day.
customer_reviews.author: nlrooster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Exactlly what i was looking for!!! Fast shipping, excellent quality. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Drozdovsky

customer_reviews.title: Mismatch
customer_reviews.text: Same as Julie. The images do not match. Received incorrect shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Julia T.

customer_reviews.title: Great as expected!
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pairs of Chaco shoes and sandals. Same fit and quality. Love Chaco’s!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hillstad

customer_reviews.title: the hype is worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love every part of these shoes. they fit perfect. I ordered them as water shoes for camp canoe trips and used them every week for 7 weeks on the river. also began to use them as my main footrlwear and they are so comfortable wet or dry.
customer_reviews.author: another dude

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Fit to my foot. There is plenty of room at the toes.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Bezzant

customer_reviews.title: Go back to making the 1” wide straps.
customer_reviews.text: My old pair of Chico’s had 1” wide straps. These new ones measure 1 1/4” wide and somewhat rubs the bend of the big toe. Other than that, they’re great
customer_reviews.author: mik dundee

customer_reviews.title: Loving finally getting it right!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found the right combo with Chaco! I have a normal 10.5 foot in women's but I have a joint replacement in the right great toe. Nothing works for me. All the women's footbeds were too small leaving my normal(not wide) foot looking like a potato in webbing. On a whim I asked to try the men's 9 on in the cloud version. Perfect fit. not too wide.(the women's wide is TOO wide) but not the men's regular. And my heel does not slip and I have a narrow heel. Can't wait to really try them out on vacation this next week. These are not nearly as heavy as the classic and oh so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Dee

product_meta.title: Chaco Men's Mega Z Cloud Sandal
product_meta.description: Water covers ¾ of the earth. Now it has you covered, too. These limited-edition Z sandals with wave-inspired webbing are made with Chaco cloud cushioning for comfort wherever you decide to make a splash.
feature_bullets: 35mm polyester jacquard webbing upper wraps around the foot and through the midsole for a customized fit adjustable and durable high-tensile webbing heel risers metal ladder lock buckle
Luvseat dual-density PU midsole Chaco Cloud cushioning for active comfort, Non-marking ChacoGrip rubber compound 3.5mm lug depth, sling-back, , , ,
